intro: Pleocnemia leuzeana var. hemiteliiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pleocnemia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its lanceolate, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which attract various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. This variety is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Pleocnemia leuzeana.
